messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: I worked five days a week before. Then I had time off for my baby. After that, I wanted more time with my children. They will start school soon.

I talked to my manager. We agreed. I would work three days a week. This meant I got less money. They pay me for the hours I work.

But then I saw something. My work did not get smaller. Now I do five days of work. I do it in three days. I get much less money for it.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS: The text fully adheres to all CEFR A2 readability standards and diagnostic protocols. Factual integrity is maintained. MeaningBERT score of 0.7741 and BERTScore of 0.9015 both meet the required thresholds, indicating excellent preservation of meaning and lexical fidelity. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. The vocabulary is strictly A2, with complex original terms like 'parental leave', 'negotiating', 'pro-rata basis', and 'workload hasn't decreased in the slightest' expertly simplified to A2 equivalents such as 'time off for my baby', 'talked to my manager. We agreed.', 'They pay me for the hours I work.', and 'My work did not get smaller.'. Sentence structures are consistently short and simple, and connectors are limited to appropriate A2 conjunctions like 'Then', 'After that', and 'But then'. This is an exemplary A2 simplification.

I talked to my manager. We agreed. I would work three days a week. This meant I got less money. They pay me for the hours I work.

But then I saw something. My work did not get smaller. Now I do five days of work. I do it in three days. I get much less money for it.
